page.title: 09QUERNMORE POST OFFICE 2
page.content: Originally the building was a public house called the "Dog & Partridge"inn. In the early 1880's,when the Thirlmere to Manchester water Aqueduct was being built many navvies came to Quernmore to help to lay the pipes.As there was no pulic transport from Quernmore to Lancaster in those days a lot of their wages was spent in the Dog & Partridge and the men were often drunk.This caused a lot of trouble in the valley. Finally the local magistrates took away the licence from the inn and it became a Temperance Hotel.At the same time it became a Post office and has remained so ever since but it is no longer a Hotel it is just a private house.The Post Office has just been sold and the new owners are planning to convert the barn into a house.
